name: ProsBloom
description: low economy, sub-rountine breakers... tons of memory

name: The Average Andy
description:
Stimhack did an article a while back on the "Anatomy of Andy" before Honor and Profit hit the shelves and talked about the most common cards in Andromeda decks that were winning tournaments. After compiling the numbers from all of the winning Andromeda deck lists on Stimhack since Honor and Profit was released where attendance was higher than 20 I found that this is the average deck. I'm not a math major but I remember bits and pieces of my high school classes so If I have made any errors please let me know!

Here are my "calculations": https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1YviQ00MG1Zwv7MbKCw1KJhZK5optcPjJWyhXg8lXJKI/pubhtml

name: Crazy Enough to Work
description:
Like the name says...

I'm really reaching here as I anticipate the release of Upstalk. Any feedback would be appreciated. :)

name: Noise 2014-06-29 (3W 1L)
description:
Very happy with this deck, Imp was great (trashed a lot of SanSan City Grids). Probably going to cut the Djinn, it's too slow and the extra MU isn't necessary. Never used The Helpful AI but it probably would have been useful a couple of times, maybe this could be cut to free up a couple of influence. The third Deja Vu would be an obvious addition.

Rd1 vs Paul (Jinteki: Replicating Perfection) Won 7-0. Rd 2 vs Matt (HB: Engineering the Future) Won 7-4. Rd 3 vs Andy (NBN: Making News) Won 7-5. Rd 4 vs Tony (HB: Engineering the Future) Lost 7-4.

name: Let's blow this thing and go home
description: Hopefully tighter but with room for a romp.

name: Pay Now, Dont Pay Later 2.0
description:
Event heavy Iain Stirling deck. The Idea been while your setting up your rig you get free credits from the corp scores, Then you pile the pressure on with events when set up with runs all over the place.

The Prepaid VoicePAD helps the econ immensely.

New Angeles lets you avoid tags all day long and completely ignore them data-ravens, the 2 fall guys help keep them up and running.

data-dealer is a shi kyu counter plus can be used to drop you back a few points if need be.

Torch, Garrote & Corroded for excellent efficiency once you get them out theirs no stopping you.

Desperado helps keep the econ going when your running.

Changes:-

Took out the plasecrete carapace it had no real value in the deck with the new angeles they carnt tag you anyway added John Masanori for some extra draw.

Changed snitch for another hostage as the snitch was of no value to me once the rigs setup nothing can stop you given the funds.

name: France Nationals - Runner up a.k.a. "Le deck du Vice"
description: Classic yet efficient HB Glacier.

name: France Nationals - Runner up a.k.a. "Le deck du Vice"
description: A standard Andromeda, with most Icebreakers in 2 copies (in case one gets discarded from hand or trashed when installed), and 3 R&D interface to lock early most Corp decks.R&D

name: Andy Anarch Suite
Andy Parasite
Rein Of Terror
description:
Pretty standard fixed breaker deck I put together for the recent Cheap Thrills tournament.

Very successful on OCTGN play tests, 50/50 during the event.

name: HM: Harm and Healing (with stuff I actually have)
description:
I liked the look of the Harm and Healing deck and decided to try and throw it together as best as possible with what I had.

There's a few things that need changing to fine tune this. Got a shopping list of future data pack purchases as this is something I'd like to develop. NAPD replacing the Private Security and Braintrust would be a priority.

name: First Deck 2.0
description:
see the earlier version and comments on a list i posted previously, called First Deck Test...

changes made to this list include a wider variety of breakers, max influence 15/15, tags and meat damage mitigation, more dependable economy, and Inside Job.

so, is this better?

name: Klover
description:
Overmind recursion with Knight support and heavy R&D pressure to get an early lock. Once ICE is stacked heavily on R&D, hit em with Nerve Agent and Legworks.

Feedback welcome!

name: Weyland GRNDL carillion v3.2
description: What is the runner going to do with bad pub but no programms? Avoiding tags? ;)

name: First Corp Deck - Bad Publicity
description:
the idea here is to use the initial 10 credits to jump ahead with big economy cards, then lock down the HQ with strong barriers and gates. meanwhile put the remote servers Off The Grid and advance the agendas. all of these agendas make a lot of bad publicity, but rather than using card slots to try and get rid of the bad publicity, this deck mitigates it with Ireress and high strength ice.

this is my first attempt at building a Corp deck, so any comments to help improve the strategy are more than welcome!

name: Haas Bioroid BrainPain
Criminal or whatever.
Astro Biotics Toronto Regionals
description: Came second Place with this deck at Toronto Regionals. The deck was undefeated until the very last game I played, in which I lost of course, giving first place to a worthy opponent. It was derived from the Paris 2014 Regionals winning deck which you can find on Stimhack.

name: Bad Publicity 2.0
description:
after getting helpful input and more consideration, I've made substantial changes from the original list I posted earlier. most notable is the elimination of the random damage cards, and the addition of a Project Atlas agenda & Code Gates to add more 'End the Run' subroutines to the barriers and Ireress.

also added are Panic Button, which makes perfect sense for this strategy, and 1 of Fast Track to help tutor for Project Atlas.

I can't wait to try this out and see if it works!

name: Chaos Theory Toronto Regionals
description: Came Second place at Toronto Regionals with this deck. Honestly Stimhack did an incredible amount of work for me, as in it actually won me games, and a lot of them.

name: Tag 'n' Brag
description: Impress your friends. Scorch your enemies.

name: CT Overnight Slumber Party
description:
Here's a version of the Knight/Overmind/Deep Red combo that I have been running recently out of CT. I picked CT because I feel the shaper recursion is really clutch with being able to be liberal with your overminds and run early and often, and the extra MU and reduced deck size are also useful.

The idea is to get out an early deep red and overmind and run everywhere. An early opus is key as well, even though it eats up MU for overmind, I've found that 5 counters is more than enough early, especially with recursion. And later on, as knights come out, even a few counters can work to get you in when you need to. Late game, grabbing breakers off of personal workshop, getting the Fem, Torch, inti, and some knights out as my full suite, although I haven had a game that has gotten to that point yet.

Thoughts from playtesting thus far:

Really love the legworks. Great in an opening hand, and really great after hitting R&D hard for a bit, forcing them to ice up, then recovering and hitting HQ once they've drawn a few agendas. I'd love an Same old thing to be able to recur one if needed. Next version of the deck may go down to two indexing and pop in the same old thing for more flexibility.

Haven't really ever gotten to use the personal workshop to get my late game suite out yet. This may be partially due to the more aggressive early game running I like to do with the deck, usually I am hesitant to take the clicks to play the workshop and host ice when I could be getting more accesses. Usually between the knights and overmind, I get in where I need to get in. I do like the idea as the backup, if for some reason knight and overmind can't get me in, or I get unlucky with accesses early and run out of steam.

The deck is super reliant on an early opus, as it's really my only econ beside the Sure gambles, and to a degree the personal workshops. I would love some other econ, but outside of dirty laundry, I am not sure what to add. Also, not sure what I would take out to fit dirty laundry in.

Thoughts and comments greatly appreciated.
